title: Improve error message in download-url for ftp support
body:
#### What is the problem?

While downloading from an FTP server (e.g., ensembl) the `requests` library throws a no connection adapter error.

FTP downloads are already supported (https://github.com/datalad/datalad/blob/master/datalad/downloaders/http.py#L52), but it requires that `requests_ftp` installed. 

While it is logged when this library is missing in debug mode, the user is not notified when trying to download an FTP URL that they need to install the `requests_ftp` package.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```
datalad download-url --path data/ -m "add: ensembl grch38 100" ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-100/gff3/homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.100.gff3.gz
[INFO   ] Downloading 'ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-100/gff3/homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.100.gff3.gz' into '/data/sample-project/data/'
download_url(error): /data/sample-project/data/ (file) [Failed to establish a new session 1 times. Last exception was: No connection adapters were found for 'ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-100/gff3/homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.100.gff3.gz' [sessions.py:get_adapter:730] [http.py:get_downloader_session:513]]
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

```
datalad --version
datalad 0.13.1.dev118
```
